Nomad
Nomad is a blocky sandbox zombie survival game. Hunt other players, craft items, kill zombies, build bases and last of all, survive!

Title: Nomad

Developer: Diminished Studios
Publisher: Diminished Studios
Release Date: Jun 26, 2015

Visit the website View update history Read related news View discussions Find Community Groups
Share Embed  

Early Access Game

Get instant access and start playing; get involved with this game as it develops.

Note: This Early Access game is not complete and may or may not change further. If you are not excited to play this game in its current state, then you should wait to see if the game progresses further in development. Learn more

What the developers have to say:

Why Early Access?

“Early access allows us to gather feedback and suggestions from the community to help make the game more enjoyable for everyone. It's also an important part of the development process because it allows players to file bug reports that we've missed.

Experience Nomad through it's development process and be a key role in the development of the game.”

Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access?

“We're hoping to be fully out of early access within a year. This is subject to change due to community input.”

How is the full version planned to differ from the Early Access version?

“The full game will feature better graphics, complete feature sets, new mechanics and improved performance.”

What is the current state of the Early Access version?

“Nomad is completely playable with lots of content.”

Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access?

“Yes. The price will increase at every major milestone (beta, release).”

How are you planning on involving the Community in your development process?

“We are hoping to involve the community by gathering feedback, ideas and suggestions via the community hub.”
Read more

Recent updates View all (23)

November 5

0.37 Patch Notes

Options
We have fixed up the options menu and provided a new feature to invert your mouse Y

Culling
Some objects has had their culling increased as they were culling (disappearing) too close to the player

Bullets
Bullets will no longer bug out and not register a hit. They will always collide with the object you're shooting at

New Military Clothes
We have added 2 new sets of military gear that only spawns in military areas. Urban and Woodland camo gear.

Full Changelog
- decreased player position and rotation lerp times
- halloween mask has been removed from all players at start
- vsync toggle fixed at start up
- you can now invert your mouseY in the in-game options
- added more rucksacks to tent spawns
- new military loot table
- more house and car loot will now spawn
- fixed floating tree near beach on new terrain
- zombies are slower
- armoured zombie now has lower HP
- armoured zombie culling has been fixed
- zombie culling has been increased from 150, to 200
- light culling has been increased from 300, to 400
- caravan LOD2 range has been increased
- decreased solver iteration count from 10, to 7
- bullets will no longer -sometimes- go through players/enemies
- minor changes to the VOIP
- 2 new sets of military clothes (woodland and urban camos)
- better network syncing on players that are far away

3 comments Read more

October 30

0.36 Patch Notes

Another big update to Nomad, this one features new zombie AI and more.

Zombies
Zombies now have pathfinding which means they will no longer walk into walls and get stuck.

Zombies now are faster and stronger than before

A new type of zombie has been added. A stronger version of a zombie with armour and increased health.

Buildings
Some stairs on the buildings have been fixed and you no longer get stuck walking up stairs

Supply Drops
Supply drops are now in the game. There are 2 different types of supply drops, a medical and a military one.

Medical supply crates drop all medical items randomly inside. Military supply crates drop all weapons and armor randomly inside.

XP System
XP system added. Each player and zombie kill will grant the player XP. XP doesn't do anything right now but later down the line we are planning on costumes that you can buy (with XP) in game.

You lose 50% of your XP on death.

Changelog
Here is the complete changelog for 0.36

- fixed stairs on red houses
- fixed stairs on super market
- added more weapons & ammo to military and police loot table
- added more weapons & ammo to houses, apartments, cars and caravan spawns
- fixed white texture issue on pine tree model
- houses will now spawn more loot
- fixed well impact collider
- small terrain changes
- added extra tent areas to new terrain piece
- street lights culling has been decreased
- zombies now have pathfinding
- zombie run and idle animation has been changed
- zombie aggro range has been increased from 50, to 75
- police outfit added (including a hat!)
- new police station loot table
- bigger and stronger zombie added
- zombies will no longer seem like they have disappeared after you die (viewing from the death cam)
- increased zombies culling out from 130 units away to 150 units away
- new zombie spawner added - this will ensure that there will always be zombies spawned in the map
- zombies will now spawn randomly around all locations and not a set amount per location
- zombie damage decreased from 8,20 to 4,10
- players will now start with a torch
- new zombie sound effects
- XP system added - this is a global xp system, used for unlocking costumes at a later stage
- added motion blur when turning fast
- added supply crates (randomly spawn in the world)
- fixed collider issue with tusten sign
- fixed bug where total number of items in storage containers wouldn't show correctly
- added more wrecked vehicles and tents around the map
- added pumpkin hat for halloween (everyone starts with it!)

4 comments Read more

About This Game

Nomad is a blocky sandbox zombie survival game. Hunt, craft, kill and survive! Nomad is set in the future after a zombie apocalypse. Find food, drink, weapons, ammo and medical supplies - or craft them!

Explore
Set years after an apocalypse, the world is over grown, broken and abandoned. Explore abandoned houses, medical buildings, police buildings, industrial buildings and military buildings. See the world many years later with wrecked vehicles littered across the lands and buildings overgrown and falling down.

Survive
Survival is key. Hunt for food and drink across the map, or simply kill others for it. Scavenge for medical items to heal broken bones and deep wounds.

PVP
Find weapons and ammo around the map and hunt down other players. Be that bloodthirsty bandito, or be a hero helping others - it's entirely up to you.

Base Building
Create your own bases by chopping down trees for wood. First create your foundation and snap walls, windows, doorways and ceilings to it. Add a door and lock it.. Place a workbench so that other players cannot build in the surrounding area. Make sure your workbench is hidden as other players can use it.

Host your own servers
Host your own server directly in game or use the stand-a-lone server located at your Nomad Steam install directory.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP
    • Processor: 1 GHz
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • DirectX: Version 9.0c
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Hard Drive: 500 MB available space
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows 7
    • Processor: 2 GHz
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • DirectX: Version 11
    • Network: Broadband Internet connection
    • Hard Drive: 500 MB available space

Posted: July 15
Early Access Review
Note: A clear example why you should not guide from the User reviews "Positive" from games and look at all the comments.

tl;dr: Another crafting multiplayer survival Minecraft look-a-like, with lack of people on all servers 24/7.

Review: This game was included in a Humble Bundle, and because of the interesting use of shadows, textures and performance I saw in videos, I gave this game a chance, but got instantly bored after 5 minutes of gameplay each time. This game is still in development, so I know there might be an improvement in lots of gameplay lacks it has, but after watching so many Minecraft style games being made and failing hard, this one is just another example of that list.

Pros:
- The graphics are pretty well made, with a good lighting system and low system specs and resources used.
- The day and night system makes a good ambience.

Cons:
- The servers are always empty, every and each one of them (there are around 20), and I get 500 ping from them (I'm from Argentina, South America).
- The traveling is slow and boring. You get to find come cities and 2 items in each house, but there is a low equipment capacity.
- The enemies are dumb as hell. They keep walking when you're behind a wall and don't have any AI at all (they are zombies, but they must have A LITTLE of brain left to kill someone).
- It's still in development, and this kind of games tend to fail. Just buy it if you have hope it will work, and with discount -75% / -80% discount (because it's the price the game should have).

Score: 2/10 , I would like to hide this game from the Library, is that possible?

Posted: October 3
Early Access Review
EA Review : October 2015
Scoring positive because i do not exactly dislike the work done so far, but I wouldnt spend money on this yet if I was you!
Okay so this game has a fleshed out world - but there is nothing noteworthy to see, a few overgrown towns and lots of grass and plains and a couple mountains. Very few zombies! I only found two in my whole play session, Lots and lots of running around with not much to do, game hints at mining and crafting, but even though i tried I couldnt really make use of it and it looked barebones at this stage. Killing zombies was a one hit affair, and they got stuck in obstacles a lot. I got really startled once as dusk became night like BANG - right away. Very sudden, still the fact they are implementing a day night cycle already is cool. The game could shape up to something... but given the alternatives out there this game will need a lot of work to attract a market share
